welcome_desc: Check out the following features by clicking the __productName__ icon in the upper-right corner of your browser.
welcome_sign_in_desc: To use the following features, click the __productName__ icon in the upper-right corner of your browser, and then provide your password.
welcome_wtp_desc: Stop phishing, banking, and technical support scams
welcome_adb_desc: Speed up your browsing by keeping unwanted ads out of sight
welcome_pwm_desc: Effortlessly sign into websites without having to remember multiple passwords
welcome_fb_desc: Protect your Gmail and Outlook against scams and phishing attacks
welcome_ps_desc: Safeguard your personal information on social networking sites
welcome_pg_desc: Protect your financial transactions on your default browser
welcome_popup_sign_in_desc: Trend Micro must verify your password again to maintain the integrity of your protection.
welcome_popup_sign_in_error_check_passwo: Check your password, then try again.
welcome_toolbar_title_edge: __Extension_Name__ is Protecting your Microsoft Edge Browser
welcome_toolbar_title_chrome: __Extension_Name__ is Protecting your Google Chrome Browser
welcome_toolbar_rating_on_desc: From now on, you can avoid opening unsafe links and websites at a glance.
welcome_toolbar_rating_on_desc_tip: Quickly see risk ratings for links found through your search engine, popular webmail, and social media sites.
welcome_toolbar_tips_desc: You also get advanced protection when visiting:
welcome_toolbar_protect_1_tip: Open banking and shopping sites in Pay Guard to protect your financial transactions, including credit card information and personal data.

welcome_toolbar_cant_see: Can’t see the __Extension_Name__ icon on your browser?

welcome_toolbar_rating_on_desc_tip_antis: Quickly see risk ratings for links found through your search engine, popular webmail, and social media sites.

eula_desc_1: __Extension_Name__ uses anonymous, technical data such as product ID, product license ID, vendor ID, and a randomly‑created client ID for deployment statistics purposes. In addition, when you visit a website, the address of that site is collected and sent to Trend Micro so we can check if the site is safe.
eula_desc_2: If you turn on Email Defender, your webmail content is sent securely to Trend Micro so we can scan it for scams, phishing attempts, and suspicious messages.
eula_desc_3: This information is used only to help protect you and improve our services. Trend Micro Toolbar will be disabled if you choose not to let us collect this data.
eula_desc_4: For more information on how we collect data and your rights regarding that data, please refer to Trend Micro’s Privacy Notice.
settings_exception_lists_desc: __productName__ will not block the websites added to this list.
settings_exception_lists_ad_desc: __productName__ will not block the ads on the websites added to this list.
settings_exceotion_list_err_invalid_url: Please enter a valid address in the correct format.
settings_exception_lists_coexist_desc: Web Threat Protection will not block the websites added to the exception list in __productName__. You can manage the trusted websites from the __productName__ main console.
settings_improve_notify: Notify me before my protection expires
settings_share_data_with_tm: Share user usage data with Trend Micro
syncing_setting_title: Syncing __productName__ settings to the __Extension_Name__, please wait...
syncing_setting_title_fail: We couldn’t sync __productName__ settings to the __Extension_Name__. Please restart your browser.
oidc_welcome_desc: The __productName__ extension helps protect you from web threats and improves your online browsing experience.
oidc_welcome_agree: By using this extension, you accept the Trend Micro License Agreement and Data Collection Notice.

transferlist_title: Select a license to protect your device
confirm_license_transfer_desc: We’ll use the license you selected to protect your device.
device_name_desc: A unique name such as ‘work laptop’ makes it easier to identify and manage your protected devices.
create_account_error_special_character: Please do not use the following special characters: > < &
welcome_OIDC_sign_in_title: Signed in successfully. Just one more step to enjoy full protection.
welcome_OIDC_sign_in_desc: Click the __Extension_Name__ icon in the top right corner of your browser to get started.
error_no_internet_desc: Please check that you are connected to the Internet and try again.
error_signin_desc: Please provide the correct email address and password.
error_internet_desc: Make sure that you are connected to the Internet, and try again.
error_generic_desc: Please try again. If the problem persists, please contact Trend Micro and mention error #__errorCode__.

error_titanium_unistall_desc: To enhance your protection, Trend Micro recommends installing __productName__. Learn more
error_s_mode_title: Trend Micro Toolbar for Microsoft Edge does not support Windows 10 in S mode.
home_desc: Stop wondering if that odd email or chat message came from a scammer and find out for sure.
advanced_check_desc: Put the suspicious message through an even more rigorous analysis designed especially for your email service.
forward_title: Just email the text of any unusual message to this address ...
text_title: ... OR, just fill in the form below.
text_label_not_sure: I am not sure but feel
lbl_forward_terms_service: By clicking Copy or sending email to this address, you agree to Trend Micro's Terms of Service.
lbl_check_now_terms_service: By clicking Check Now, you agree to Trend Micro's Terms of Service.
lbl_no_need_personal_info: You do not need to include any personal information.
lbl_not_click_link: Please do NOT click on the link in the message.
result_unsafe_content_desc: Many users reported similar messages as scams. For your safety, ignore any instructions or requests in this message unless you already know and trust the sender.
result_unsupport_language: Email Defender only supports English and Japanese
result_unsupport_language_suspect_desc: Send this email to Trend Micro for analysis by clicking the Report Scam button.
result_whitelist_desc: Although this message is sent by someone you trust, you should always take care when someone asks you to make a financial transaction or share personal information online.
result_no_threats_found_desc: Although this message seems safe, you should always take care when someone asks you to make a financial transaction or share personal information online.
result_no_threats_found_attachment_desc:
Although this message seems safe, files attached to it may still contain hidden risks.
Avoid opening or sharing attachments to protect yourself and others.
result_level_high_desc:
Ignore any instructions in this message.
Do not share any personal or financial information in response to it.
Delete the original message and block the sender.
result_level_middle_desc: This message seems fraudulent, so you should avoid responding to it or taking any action that it requests.
result_level_low_desc: Although this message seems safe, you should always take care when someone asks you to make a financial transaction or share personal information online.
result_level_unknown_desc: Try the Advanced Scam Check to determine if this message poses a risk.
result_get_more_support: Contact Trend Micro to get more support.
source_title: For Gmail, Yahoo! Mail, and Outlook Mail
source_text: Watch this video to learn how to create a source file, then paste it into the box below.
upload_title: For the Microsoft Outlook Desktop Client
upload_text: Watch this video to learn how to create an .eml or .msg file, then drag and drop it below.
upload_info: Drag and drop the .eml or .msg file here.
upload_incorrect_format: Please try again with a file in the correct format.
reasoning_summary_title: Follow the suggestions below to protect yourself:
reasoning_summary_scam_title: If you do not already know and trust the sender, follow these suggestions:
reasoning_summary_item1: Ignore any instructions in this message.
reasoning_summary_item2: Do not call any phone number in this message.
reasoning_summary_item3: Do not click any links that supposedly take you to a website.
reasoning_summary_item4: Do not share any personal or financial information in response to it.
reasoning_summary_item6: Delete the original message and block the sender.
tutorial_text_step1: Copy the original suspicious message text, then come back to this website.
tutorial_text_step2: Paste the suspicious message text into the Message Text box and indicate the source below the box.
tutorial_text_step3: Click Check Now to get the results.
tutorial_forward_step1: Click the Copy button to keep the email address handy.
tutorial_forward_step2: Go back to the suspicious email message and forward it to the address you just copied.
tutorial_forward_step3: Wait a few minutes to get the results.
tutorial_source_step1: Click the menu icon in the upper right corner of the suspicious email.
tutorial_source_step3: Paste the source code below and then click Check Now to get the results.
tutorial_upload_step1: Drag the suspicious email message from Outlook onto your desktop.
tutorial_upload_step2: Drag and drop the file from your desktop to the uploading area.
tutorial_upload_step3: Click Check Now to get the results.
lbl_feedback_question: How do you feel about Email Defender?
lbl_feedback_reason2: I do not understand the results or the results seem confusing.
lbl_feedback_placeholder: Please share your thoughts in detail, if you like.
lbl_feedback_moretosay: Thanks for your feedback. Do you have more to say?
user_feedback_success: Report sent. Thank you for your feedback.
feedback_reportScamDesc: Send this email to Trend Micro for analysis by clicking the Report Scam button.
feedback_reportFalseAlarmDesc: Send this email to Trend Micro for analysis by clicking the Report False Alarm button.
feedback_notice: Your feedback will only be used to improve Email Defender and will not be shared with third parties. Trend Micro will not contact you regarding your feedback.
email_result_not_click_link: Please do NOT click on the link in the message.
topic_Generic: This scam does not yet fit into a defined category.
topic_Advance fee: These scams typically seek to convince the victim to make a payment up front in exchange for much more money later. The criminals usually want to receive funds through instant wire transfer services like Western Union and MoneyGram because they can easily vanish after receiving the cash. Never make transfers like these to people you have not met in person.
topic_Lottery, sweepstakes and competiti: Genuine lotteries and sweepstakes never notify winners through email messages. Winners must have actually bought a lottery or sweepstakes ticket first. Real lotteries and sweepstakes never communicate using free email accounts (like Gmail) and would never ask the recipient to call a mobile phone number. No lottery or sweepstakes would instruct a winner to keep the prize a secret, and none would ever ask a winner to pay any fees to receive a prize.
topic_Dating and romance: This type of scam involves creating fake profiles on legitimate dating websites and then using them start relationships with victims to get their money and personal details.
topic_Shopping and auction: This type of scam collects credit card or bank account details of victims by offering a compelling deal but then delivering something faulty or of inferior quality, or else nothing at all.
topic_Banking & credit card: This type of scam involves sending email or text messages that seem to come from a legitimate bank, financial institution, or online payment service. The messages typically claim that the victim must verify their account information using a fake but convincing copy of the supposed sender’s website.
topic_Job and employment: This type of scam offers the chance to earn a lot of money while working from home or invest in a lucrative business opportunity after the victim makes an upfront payment. Variants persuade victims to cash fake checks and money orders, putting them at risk of criminal prosecution.
topic_Investments: These scams typically offer a fraudulent investment opportunity in company shares, real estate, stock options, or foreign currency trading. The victim never receives anything.
topic_Charity and medical: This type of scam swindles victims by asking for donations to help solve a health crisis or other seemingly good cause without ever using the money for the stated purpose.
topic_Threats & extortion: This type of scam involves hijacking the victim's computer and then claiming to have evidence that the victim of the fraud has cheated, or even threatening to detonate a bomb.
topic_Pensions & Tax refund scam: This type of scam attempts to convince victims to convert pension benefits into cash before they have reached their retirement age to defraud them.
topic_Inheritance: Victims of this type of scam expect to receive a great deal of money after sending a smaller amount to someone posing as a lawyer or other intermediary claiming to control a huge inheritance. After making the transfer, the sender receives nothing, while the criminals not only keep the funds, but also often learn personal information about the victim.
topic_Phishing (not detected by FMA mode: This type of scam tries to collect credit card details, account credentials, and other personal information with deceptive instant or email messages and websites. The deceptions may involve offering fake gift cards, fraudulent computer software, or false security warnings.
persuasion_fees: Avoid making payments in advance to anyone you know only through email messages, especially if promised a lot of money in return. Never send money through Western Union or MoneyGram to strangers. Instant wire transfer services offer no protection against fraud.
persuasion_info: Scammers may ask a victim for personal data not only for identity theft but also to make the scam seem more authentic by producing fancy "certificates" using the victim's name and address as a psychological trick.
persuasion_authority/impersonation: Scammers may use fake names and companies to communicate legitimacy, trust, and credibility. They often include professional affiliations and titles to seem more impressive. They may even masquerade as a business colleague or manager of the victim.
persuasion_confidentiality: Scammers tell victims to keep transactions secret to help prevent them from recognizing the scam.
persuasion_fear/threats: Scammers try to intimidate the victim by threatening to delete, freeze, or suspend the victim's account.
persuasion_flattery/ingratiation: Scammers write excessively formal messages (Dear Sir or Madam, Good Day, etc.) to ingratiate themselves with their victims.
persuasion_pity/shared values: Scammers try to inspire sympathy in the victim and emphasize ideals and values to convince the victim to cooperate.
persuasion_reward: Scammers want victims to focus only on the prospect of quick money, but only the scammer ends up receiving any funds.
persuasion_urgency: Scammers try to rush their victims to make quick decisions before they become suspicious.
persuasion_zero risk: Online scammers rarely get arrested or face any consequences for their crimes. However, you will lose any money that you send to them.
persuasion_seduction: Scammers try to fool lonely victims into revealing personal information by promising romance or sex.
phishing_link: Phishing link: Do not click this link.
malicious_link: Malicious link: Do not click this link.
fake_link: Fake link: Do not click this link. It may look safe, but it actually opens a website containing potential threats.
malicious_link_suspicious: Associated with spam or has a history of being comprised.
malicious_link_highly suspicious: Possibly a phishing page or a potential source of malware or spyware.
malicious_link_dangerous: Verified to be a phishing page or a source of malware or spyware.
suspicious_email: Suspicious email address: Do not send messages to this address.
fake_email: Fake email address: Do not send messages to this address. It may look safe, but it actually belongs to scammers.
suspicious_phone: Suspicious phone number: Do not call this number.
phishing_image: This image contains a phishing link. To prevent potential threats, please do not click the image.
malicious_image: This image contains a malicious link. To prevent potential threats, please do not click the image.
error_info1: If the problem persists, contact Trend Micro
error_info2: and mention the following error code: __errorCode__.
